item.title: Configure AIManager
item.description: Configure AIManager In this chapter you will: Integrate AIManager with OpenLDAP for user management Integrate AIManager with ELK for Log Anomalies Define and train AI Models for Log Anomaly Detectiom Metric Anomaly Detection Event Grouping Similar Incidents Change Risk Create Policies for Story creation and Runbook assignment Integrate AIManager with Ansible Tower and create Runbooks in AIManager Create a RobotShop Application Topology Integrate AIManager with Slack

item.title: Get the information
item.description: Get the configuration Information Run the following command to get a list of all the information that you will need for the configuration of AIManager in this chapter. ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh This will provide you with all the information and details that you need to configure AIManager in this chapter. ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh > MY_CONFIGURATION.txt

item.title: First Login
item.description: Your first Login to AIManager In your OpenShift Console click on the Applications Menu Select CP4WAIOps Demo UI Login with token P4ssw0rd! Copy the Admin Password Open AIManager Select IBM provided credentials Login with admin user and the password you copied in the step above Welcome to AIManager

item.title: Initialize ELK
item.description: Initial ELK Setup In your OpenShift Console click on the Applications Menu Select Logging Click Allow selected permissions Input app* for the index pattern Click Next Step Select @timestamp for time filter Click Create Index Pattern Click on Discover ELK is now configured. Verify that you have Logs coming in.

item.title: Configure LDAP
item.description: Configure LDAP integration Create LDAP provider In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Access Control In the top right Click Identity provider configuration You might have to re-login with your admin user In the top right Click New Connection Select LDAP from the dropdown Click Next ðŸ”Ž Get the data from your configuration info - section 2.1 Configure LDAP ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh Fill out the first section of fields: Connection name: LDAP Server type: Custom Base DN: dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN: cn=admin,dc=ibm,dc=com Bind DN password: P4ssw0rd!

item.title: Configure ELK
item.description: Configure ELK Integration In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Define/Data and tool connections Click Add connection Under ELK, click on Add connection Click Connect Name it ELK ðŸ”Ž Get the data from your configuration info - section 2.2 Configure ELK ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh Fill out the fields on the first page: ELK service URL: from script Kibana URL: from script Authentication type: Token Token: from script Mapping: { "codec": "elk", "message_field": "message", "log_entity_types": "kubernete s.

item.title: Configure Runbooks
item.description: Configure Runbooks Create Ansible Tower Connection In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Define/Data and tool connections Click Add connection Under Ansible Automation Controller, click on Add connection Click Connect ðŸ”Ž Get the data from your configuration info - section 2.3 Configure Runbooks - Ansible Automation Controller ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh Fill out the fields: URL for REST API: from script Authentication type: User ID/Password User: admin Password: from script Click Done Make sure that the Connection Status turn green after a few seconds

item.title: Configure Policies
item.description: Configure Policies Enable Story creation Policy In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Operate/Automations Select tab Policies Click on the Tag dropdown Select Stories and Runbooks Turn on Policy Default story creation policy for all alerts Create Runbook Assignment Policy Click on Create Policy Click on Assign a runbook to alerts Name it RobotShop Mitigate MySQL Problem Scroll down to Condition sets Click in field Property Type name Select resource / name

item.title: Configure Applications
item.description: Create Kubernetes Observer In the AIManager “Hamburger” Menu select Define/Data and tool connections Click Add connection Under Kubernetes, click on Add connection Click Connect ðŸ”Ž Get the data from your configuration info - section 2.5 Configure Applications - RobotShop Kubernetes Observer ./tools/11_fzth/get_configuration_info.sh Fill out the first section of fields (Add connection): Name: RobotShop Data center: robot-shop Click Next Fill out the first section of fields (Set advanced options): Kubernetes master IP address: 172.

item.title: Configure Certificates
item.description: Create valid Ingress Certificates This creates valid certificates for the OpenShift Ingress, so that you can integrate with Slack. Patch NetworkPolicy Run the following command to patch the NetworkPolicy export WAIOPS_NAMESPACE=$(oc get po -A|grep aiops-orchestrator-controller |awk '{print$1}') cat <<EOF | oc apply -f - apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1 kind: NetworkPolicy metadata: name: allow-all-egress-and-ingress annotations: argocd.argoproj.io/sync-wave: "3" namespace: $WAIOPS_NAMESPACE spec: egress: - {} ingress: - {} podSelector: {} policyTypes: - Egress - Ingress EOF Run the following command to patch AutomationUIConfig Certificates
